hippodrome

Class Paddock

  • java.lang.Object
    • hippodrome.Paddock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PaddockInterface, java.rmi.Remote

    public class Paddock
extends java.lang.Object
implements PaddockInterface
    Place where the horses are paradded before the Spectators. As the pairs Horse/Jockey comes here, it means that each and everyone of them is getting prepared to be on the next race.
    Since:
    0.1

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Paddock(GeneralInformationRepositoryInterface repository, int numberOfSpectators, int numberOfHorses)
      Creates a Paddock.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getNumberOfEntitiesDeclaringExit()
      Gives the number of entities running on this hippodrome region which will exit the simulation.
      boolean goCheckHorses()
      Signal given by the Broker in order to the Spectators go check the pairs Horse/Jockey and verify if there are more to come.
      Response goCheckHorses(int spectator, boolean isTheLastSpectator)
      Changes the Spectator's state to Appraising the Horses (ATH) and waits till the last proceedToStartLine(int).
      void proceedToPaddock(int raceNumber)
      Changes the state of the pair Horse/Jockey to At the Paddock (ATP) and waits for the last Spectator to arrive on Paddock on the goCheckHorses(int, boolean) method.
      Response proceedToStartLine(int horseJockeyId)
      Signal that the race is about to start, by a HorseJockey.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Paddock

        public Paddock(GeneralInformationRepositoryInterface repository,
               int numberOfSpectators,
               int numberOfHorses)
        Creates a Paddock.
        This constructor creates a Paddock giving a number of pairs Horse/Jockey and a number of Spectators. Plus, an instance of the repository is also given in order to report status changes on the course of its actions.
        Parameters:
        numberOfSpectators - The number of Spectators which will be attending the event.
        numberOfHorses - The number of pairs Horse/Jockey which will be competing.
        repository - an instance of a GeneralInformationRepositoryInterface in order to report all the actions and log each and every moment.

    • Method Detail

      • proceedToPaddock

        public void proceedToPaddock(int raceNumber)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Changes the state of the pair Horse/Jockey to At the Paddock (ATP) and waits for the last Spectator to arrive on Paddock on the goCheckHorses(int, boolean) method.
        This method also resets the condition variable of the goCheckHorses(int, boolean) method.
        Specified by:
        proceedToPaddock in interface PaddockInterface
        Parameters:
        raceNumber - number identification of the race which is about to begin.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the wait() is interrupted.

      • goCheckHorses

        public Response goCheckHorses(int spectator,
                              boolean isTheLastSpectator)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Changes the Spectator's state to Appraising the Horses (ATH) and waits till the last proceedToStartLine(int). It also notifies proceedToPaddock(int) when the last Spectator is about to appraise the horse - you fool.
        Specified by:
        goCheckHorses in interface PaddockInterface
        Parameters:
        isTheLastSpectator - identification if the last Spectator has reached the premises - if true; otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the wait() is interrupted.

      • proceedToStartLine

        public Response proceedToStartLine(int horseJockeyId)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Signal that the race is about to start, by a HorseJockey.
        Note that this method changes the value of the condition variable to the goCheckHorses(int, boolean) wait condition, notifying its changes.
        Specified by:
        proceedToStartLine in interface PaddockInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • goCheckHorses

        public boolean goCheckHorses()
        Signal given by the Broker in order to the Spectators go check the pairs Horse/Jockey and verify if there are more to come. This must be done in order to establish a more accurate bet on the probable winner.
        Specified by:
        goCheckHorses in interface PaddockInterface
        Returns:
        true if the last Spectator has moved to the Paddock; otherwise false.

      • getNumberOfEntitiesDeclaringExit

        public int getNumberOfEntitiesDeclaringExit()
        Gives the number of entities running on this hippodrome region which will exit the simulation.
        Specified by:
        getNumberOfEntitiesDeclaringExit in interface PaddockInterface
        Returns:
        the number of entities which declares death.
